page.title: 16The Cycletrack. Kingswood.
page.content: Part of the{Bristol and Bath {Railway Path and Cycle Route}runs through the Kingswood area. The {Cycletrack}follows the course of the old{London Midland and Scottish {Railway. In 1978 an organisation called {Cyclebag}set out to reopen the line as a path for{cyclists}and{walkers.}By 1979 the first 5 miles had been completed from{Bitton}to{Bath.}Today it is possible to cycle or walk the 15 miles from{Lawrence Hill, Bristol}to {Bath. }This is the first cycletrack in this country to use a{disused railway line. At Staple Hill there is a tunnel one quarter of a mile long which runs under Staple Hill school playing field. At Bitton a{preservation {society}has opened a section of railway track and{steam trains}are hauled regularly.
